Harold Hill
-2-
March 7, I960
Through the Television Committee I heard of the plans being made
by the/JACET to develop a curriculum for teachers colleges dealing
with classroom utilization of television programs, I met with the
two associate secretaries of this organization and we discussed
our joint projects. They feel that our materials are drastically
needed by the education colleges and requested that they be kept
thoroughly informed of our development plans. At present their
curriculum study is in a tentative outline form and as soon as it
is edited they will send me a copy. On Wednesday afternoon we
had a second meeting of the DAVI Television Committee and at that
time we explored further the arrangement and plans for the invita¬
tional seminar. At the committee’s suggestion, I have written to
Ann Hyer to see if I might be added as official member of the DAVI
Television Committee.
I talked with Dr. McPherson for nearly an hour and a half. We went
over .the proposal as submitted to his office. He had several sug¬
gestions to improve the proposal. Let me go over them one by one.
First, he felt that we should spell out in a little more detail the
exact kind of audience we would be aiming toward. He seemed to have
some difficulty in getting the picture of how these kits would be
used. I guess that I felt that this was so obvious to everyone it
would not need to be spelled out. He suggested that we submit
a one or two page supplement, and I will' get busy on this right
away, and.send it to you for forwarding with your comments to the
H. S, Office* He felt that our time schedule and our phase plan
were entirely feasible and would fit into their plan nicely. He
suggested that we might want to correlate some of our work with
several other people that are currently either doing projects for
him or are being considered for projects. He couldn't tell me
who these were off hand but I will write him to find out what he
had reference to. He suggested that in the budget we had not in¬
cluded enough time for the project director. His estimate was a
third to a fourth time to get the thing under way. I think that
we would agree, it would probably take more than a fifth time but
for the first phase this looked entirely logical and I would sug¬
gest.not changing it. The second thing on the budget,he had the
feeling that we should include a few other items. These are mostly
housekeeping items such as administrative services and the 1% over-
